A wooly mammoth transporter from several years ago.
A student holds up her hopper. She is sad because her hopper is too heavy to hop. :(
A pangolin transporter from 2013. It was able to curl up into a ball and roll.
A student talks to some of the community partners at E4H kick-off day.
Students show their community partners what they\'ve been working on.
Students present their work to an audience of other students and community partners at a design review.
Students show off their mechanical hand at Expo.

Students test their mechanical hand at the end of Mechanical Prototyping in their classroom.
A pair of first-years show off their final project: a cat that comes to you when you meow at it.
A team of first-years present their final project: a series of circuits that detects fear.
The final poster of a materials science final project.

The final poster of a materials science final project.
The process first-years are taught in ModSim: real world -> model -> implementation -> results -> real world.
An example of a final project poster for ModSim.
A student working on creating a model for a population model involving sharks, rays, and scallops.
Students work together to finish their project in a PoE lab.
A group of students created a self-playing guitar.
The Confectionary Cannon: A PoE project from 2013 that detected a face and shot a marshmallow at the mouth.
A student holds up Jimmy, a humanoid robot.
The robotic tuna that has been an Olin project for several years.
The Olin Robotic Sailing team.
A team poses for a picture with the company they\'re working for.
